comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Must be 1913-1914 trying to beat Edward Payson Weston's record for the same walk. In 1909 Weston walked 4,000 miles, from New York, New York to San Francisco, California, in 100 days.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: There appear to be three of them, probably Italian-American "favorite sons." The crowd is posed before an Italian-American fraternal hall, and the boys are hawking copies of an Italian-language newspaper, "Il Telegrafo."

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Another Bain/LOC photo of the Frisco Walkers, this time identified by surnames: Farina, Zanolini and Conti.  -----
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4953638949/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: Wystan: Thanks for pointing out the related image with their names.  We'll add these to the record next time we update.

comment._content:
